document.title: Quick Glance Checklist: 2020 NC ELD Standard Course of Study

2FC0CCBDA40F4DC78F44800459AB3963.description: Show relationships between claims and counterclaims, differences in perspectives, and evidence and reasoning

02E28AA92CD3441C8BA4A4559EE0CC5E.description: Select relevant information to support claims with evidence gathered from multiple sources

19D7E976D59A4574B615280AC177C1CE.description: Argue.Expressive: Construct social studies arguments that:

C849C044CBA3425EA672C434A7506211.description: Evaluating point of view and credibility of source based on relevance and intended use

FC5516BD6E674B2F8A7EAFEA453422C4.description: Analyzing relevant information from multiple sources to support claims

0216AC22ABFC4981945F2E2998B48D52.description: Identifying topic and purpose (argue in favor or against a position, present a balanced interpretation, challenge perspective)

CDADF99211E44BD4A3BA261D7AA619C3.description: Argue.Interpretive: Interpret social studies arguments by:

B53FC18EE7954DF7B44B98A793CD3D18.description: Generalize multiple causes and effects of developments or events

A28B7B6468EF4BF2AD8153FFA502D53B.description: Develop reasoning, sequences with linear and nonlinear relationships, evidence, and details, acknowledging strengths and weaknesses

AF5F67266C8646399A40F5E6E299F66D.description: Establish perspective for communicating outcomes, consequences, or documentation

94F27C78E50549E7A419429ECD46F4ED.description: Introduce and contextualize phenomena or events

08F82CEC1AE0467386ECC7BB5A6D6901.description: Explain.Expressive: Construct social studies explanations that:

B5A6521888DF43DD9B887E25EB80ABEC.description: Evaluating experts’ points of agreement, along with strengths and weakness of explanations

DEDE437FD51D4DD09B823E0FEF7A4F4A.description: Analyzing sources for logical relationships among contributing factors or causes

0E1A4E9468944A7CBAEC6067D5DA0D02.description: Determining multiple points of view in sources for answering compelling and supporting questions about phenomena or events

01833BDFBE1A4545A451BF82358E97F9.description: Explain.Interpretive Interpret social studies explanations by:

814A606415654139A677FD0CD933F779.description:
Signal logical relationships among reasoning, evidence, data, and/or a model when
making or defending a claim or counterclaim

C72E727F7C064BC1957AF9590F373503.description: Establish and maintain a neutral or objective stance

EEEB7717CDD2409B9F8992FAE8E1D496.description: Support or refute a claim based on data and evidence

7A5A4D2638C64CCAB91D6362EE251C54.description: Introduce and contextualize topic/phenomenon in issues related to the natural and designed world(s)

913A6331AB854C648F7D10D0830F4908.description: Evaluating whether they emphasize similar or different evidence and/or interpretations of facts

FBDEE57E43684C21BB665ABD94BEC5CA.description: Comparing reasoning and claims based on evidence from two arguments on the same topic

454C3E0959314EBD9B6C32012D261AB4.description: Identifying convincing evidence from data, models, and/or information from investigations of phenomena or design solutions

6CA73D094771494FBDCBEAFB3D779016.description: Summarize patterns in evidence, making trade-offs, revising, and retesting

20A18F49C95342A48180EE442017E6FA.description: Develop reasoning to show relationships among independent and dependent variables in models and simple systems

917AD0266CCF47DC8C2CD6B0D9170C4E.description: Establish neutral or objective stance in how results are communicated

233D29C1A0E34F08916AB72B903AA378.description: Describe valid and reliable evidence from sources about a phenomenon

D23B5D95308441AB8132F95895B826E8.description: Evaluating scientific reasoning that shows why data or evidence adequately supports conclusions

21730D1D9D31436F9B07BB058F08DD13.description: Determining central ideas in complex evidence and information to help explain how or why a phenomenon occurs

111F33327E3F43C4850A60789E793BEB.description: Defining investigable questions or design problems based on observations, information, and/or data about a phenomenon

CCBAE5FD29BC4508B1F1CE77007F18E3.description: Justify conclusions with evidence and mathematical facts

15CAA63EEE66449793F3B9762D860534.description: Create conjecture, using definitions and previously established results

51A589493FAB442B8D76EFAB7CAF1C1F.description: Evaluating relationships between evidence and mathematical facts to create generalizations

25A5642DAF0C4FEBBDBC5B492385E339.description: Comparing conjectures with previously established results

9CD8F4C8E7484750920AB9C73035D2C6.description: State reasoning used to generate solution

3023534BA56944B79D647DB4C35E24F6.description: Evaluating model and rationale for underlying relationships in selected problem-solving approach

62524DC860CD4CB0B82F77804026CAFB.description: Analyzing possible ways to represent and solve a problem

7CEBF0B5F9C44A769AF466DC104EA301.description: Logically organize claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence; offer a conclusion

4273997F89AD4597A3252351A1D3004F.description: Support claims with reasons and evidence that are clear, relevant, and credible

039A5ADD46DA49568D15B79F762F8A91.description: Introduce and develop claim(s) and acknowledge counterclaim(s)

AB2FC3BFC744420ABCDEF5A26E8D7001.description: Argue.Expressive: Construct language arts arguments that:

5B17C405797E4FBD82B3E45D29887E00.description: Evaluating relevance, sufficiency of evidence, and validity of reasoning that support claim(s)

AF45669F6F7B438B8EF8E1A5B166C9BA.description: Analyzing how an author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints

1C5ADC1AFEED4533B3DAEAD3A60E1725.description: Identifying and summarizing central idea distinct from prior knowledge or opinions

1F734E3CA4544B95A046968992C76FED.description: Argue.Interpretive: Interpret language arts arguments by:

6866C084A68A439F96FE9EE7E63BC44D.description: Develop coherence and cohesion throughout text

F69C170462C14E67BFD77A0F44A4AB35.description: Add precision, details, and clarity about relevant attributes, qualities, characteristics, activities, and behaviors

E7BC7252765A47E0A43B8E821F26B78B.description: Introduce and define topic and/or entity for audience

A0801AE720CF462CAFCE09DC3445E6C0.description:
Inform.Expressive: Construct informational texts in language arts (with prompting
and support) that:

A4D213D8D4B44C80AF91135E3EC3A3EF.description: Evaluating the impact of author’s key word choices over the course of a text

0CFCD9762A8A4C588DB58913346874C7.description: Analyzing observations and descriptions in textual evidence for key attributes, qualities, characteristics, activities, and behaviors

9A44A0F3C7464007A4967015E141BE19.description: Identifying and/or summarizing main ideas and their relationship to supporting ideas

C44B7DE61ABC4A02906B4D45335AB4B2.description:
Inform.Interpretive: Interpret informational texts in language arts (with prompting
and support) by:

98EC542DF8EA476CA3BDA82CB2F659F9.description: Develop story, including themes with complication and resolution, time, and event sequences

0279EBAEF1E14D6F8FAC942802117C5E.description: Develop and describe characters and their relationships

2464835F2C2743D1879F4B8E9BA62AD9.description: Orient audience to context and point of view

A896A23117594836AD7DA38E892E3493.description:
Narrate.Expressive: Construct language arts narratives (with prompting and support)
that:

C364E446F5D54D52918F4C93DC5B0B42.description: Evaluating impact of specific word choices about meaning and tone

8A5A8C4C206A41389F7AE3E52DAC48E9.description: Analyzing how character attributes and actions develop in relation to events or dialogue

D16C01FB11914545BD4F67914E29717E.description: Identifying a theme or central idea that develops over the course of a text

825A7CFCDEA64930B8427627F84B3420.description:
Narrate.Interpretive: Interpret language arts narratives (with prompting and support)
by:

16E06645443B4FC4B561284EA127254E.description: Refine claims and reasoning based on new information or evidence

3BFE1D6534264ED8B553BB057D5D2B14.description: Evaluate changes in thinking, identifying trade-offs

520FBA1D37FC4496B9940D23B8977870.description: Clarify and elaborate ideas based on feedback

28AF5F9A98124E8DB06A909974876072.description: Support or challenge an opinion, premise, or interpretation

AB86C0BA2D484DED8FA657B37C91B1E2.description: Act on feedback to revise understandings of how or why something is or works in particular ways

0CBAE367DB3B4F3D82FB6247A5B5A8E0.description: Offer alternatives to extend or deepen awareness of factors that contribute to particular outcomes

8461AA5E63CC41E7A35B3CA6F5FBD554.description: Compare changing variables, factors, and circumstances

CB19A8E1CA2B4C6BB2A236DD5E120086.description: Follow and describe cycles and sequences of steps or procedures and their causes and effects

E3032529ED894CF48B2338EC1513C0EB.description: Summarize most important aspects of information

20CAFC5ECD5347289C59BEC09A35061D.description: Describe the parts and wholes of a system

2C189101A39D4BD7B55591DD46AB2C35.description: Report on explicit and inferred characteristics, patterns, or behavior

8327089A67F848AAA81886F9EA5A7D64.description: Define and classify facts and interpretations; determine what is known vs. unknown

BBBD55BA85214D48B24D094380DDD47F.description: Create closure, recap, and offer next steps

B75A6AFDD27B479A84DF124ABF526706.description: Recount and restate ideas to sustain and move dialogue forward

7E8B4C6C20B444FFA828F2774B3D54D7.description: Identify and raise questions about what might be unexplained, missing, or left unsaid

1429ABF14FBB45A48EEF68D5E099A560.description: Connect stories with images and representations to add meaning

1901F17BCA304993A4E492E4A296092F.description: Share ideas about one’s own and others’ lived experiences and previous learning
